name: Accelerated Aging
effect:
- Each turn, the crew or dragon card on which played increases in strength by 1 point.
- May not be played on cards with a current strength of 6 or greater.
- No additional strength modifications may be made to the affected card.
- Crew or dragon is discarded upon reaching 10 strength points.

name: Accelerated Burn
effect:
- Played to any star, system, white dwarf or protostar terrain card.
- During the next Allocation Phase the affected terrain generates double points.
- The terrain is then discarded if it is of equal or lower strength than this card.
- If it is of higher strength, it produces no points on the turn after producing double points.
- Discarded after use.

name: Anti-Time Exchange
effect:
- When played to the discard pile allows the owning player to discard up to 3 randomly selected cards from one opponent's hand.
- Opponent replaces those discarded with newly drawn cards from his own deck.
- May discard specific cards previously viewed by a scout function or other such function.
- Discarded after use.

name: Anti-Time Mine Field
effect:
- When played on an opponent ship of equal or lesser strength ship is placed at the bottom of the deck or into the reserve fleet discarding a card there of equal or higher strength. (Ship owner's choice).
- Accompanying cards are placed back in the hand.
- Discarded after use.

name: Artifact - Timeglass
effect:
- Played to the highest strength crew card in play. Aster one turn, is moved to any other crew card which has not possessed the timeglass.
- The crew possessing the timeglass is immune to card plays and actions.
- Discarded after 4 crew have possessed the timeglass.

name: Aurora Borealis
effect:
- Played on a terrain card.
- Each turn during the Allocation Phase one card is drawn from the deck and exposed.
- If it is a ship, base, dragon, crew, psy or equipment card it is immediately placed anywhere on the terrain stack as long as that would be a legal card play.
- All other cards are placed back on the deck.
- Discarded when the terrain card is.

name: Base Relocation
effect:
- Played to a tug.
Allows a tug to move 1 base from one terrain to another.
- Discarded after use.

name: Base Thrusters
effect:
- Allows the base on which it is played to change location moving from one terrain to another once each complete turn.
- May not be used if there is no other terrain card to move to.
- Costs no energy, but is discarded when played in reaction mode.

name: Catastrophic Repetition
effect:
A ship or base has been caught in an almost instantaneous repeating time loop.
- Played during the Weapons Fire Phase.
- Each weapon point on the ship/base scores 5 times as much damage (no other modifications allowed).
- Discard the ship or base and all accompanying cards when this is done.
- Discarded after use.

name: Cessation of Engagement
effect:
- When played during an opponent's Engagement Phase one unit chosen by the player of this card cannot be engaged.
- Points allocated to that unit are lost.
- Placed at the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Cessation of Events
effect:
- When played during an opponent's Play Cards Phase B that phase is ended.
- Prevents any and all card plays from occuring in Card Play Phase B including extra card plays generated by any means.
- Placed at the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Cessation of Fire
effect:
- When played during an opponent's Weapons Fire Phase that phase is ended.
- Halts current and subsequent volleys that turn.
- Placed at the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Cessation of Production
effect:
- When played during an opponent's Allocation Phase one terrain card or stack chosen by the player of this card cannot generate points on that turn.
- Placed at bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Cessation of Time
effect:
- When played during an opponent's Draw Cards Phase that phase is ended.
- Prevents any and all card draws.
- Placed at the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Continuum Disorder
effect:
- Draw a card and immediately play it.
- Cards which cannot be played are discarded.
- Designate an opponent to draw a card from his deck and play it (not a card play).
- If opponent's card is of lower strength than your's he designates a different opponent to draw and lay a card.
- Continues until a card of equal or higher strength than yours is drawn or each player has drawn 1 card.
- Discarded after use.

name: Crew Capture
effect:
- Played to a crew card of equal or lesser strength.
- Crew is captured and placed on the highest strength terrain card in play in the capturing player's fleet.
- Crew is not usable.
- Recovery requires a there-and-back mission by an attack-capable crew.
- Discarded after use.

name: Criminal Judge
effect:
- Each turn, any opponent crew card of equal or lesser strength selected by judge player is moved to the judge's location during the Allocation Phase.
- Research points are allocated to the crew card by the judge player.
- Crew-owning player's must match the research points during his next Allocation Phase to move the crew card back, otherwise crew is discarded.

name: Crinkled Timeline
effect:
- Played on any one card (but not the basis of a stack) in a fleet.
- The affected card is placed back on top of its owner's deck.
- This card is placed on the bottom of its owner's deck. If there is no deck remaining discard it.

name: Cryogenic Convict
effect:
A failed form of past imprisonment. Frozen for a time period equal to his sentence, the cryogenic convict has just thawed and escaped.
- Played to a location in any opponent fleet without a penal colony.
- Each Allocation Phase, economy points equal to the strength of the cryogenic convict is paid to fund capture efforts.

name: Cybercyst
effect:
This creature has moved from reality into cyber space, ending its physical existence.
- Played on any opponent fleet.
- All crew and equipment cards in the fleet require twice the engagement points.
- Special functions that require points do not require double points.
- Discarded when a cyber mage of equal or higher strength is played into the affected fleet or when energy points equal to twice its strength have been applied.

name: Cybersist
effect:
This being has moved himself from the real world into the computer networks, ending his physical existence.
- All crew cards in the fleet do not require engagement points while the cybersist is in play.
- Special functions of that crew which require points still require points.

name: Discard Delay
effect:
- Played to any card or stack of cards about to be discarded.
- Card or stack of cards is set aside out of play.
- The stack is returned to the discard pile 2 turns later during the Discard Phase of the delay player.
- Discarded after use.

name: Discard Exchange
effect:
- Played to a card just discarded.
- Allows the discarded card to be placed into the hand or the reserve fleet, discarding a card from that same place of equal or higher strength.
- Placed on the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Distortion Generator
effect:
- Played to the lowest strength ship in the fleet.
- For 1 turn, ship cannot be damaged in any way unless it is disengaged.
- Ship may fire, protect its Sector HQ and otherwise function normally.
- This card negates and/or prevents a Divergent Anomaly, discarding it.
- Discarded after use.

name: Dream State
effect:
- Played on an opponent crew card.
- Crew card may not be used until 2 research points have been allocated to this card on the same turn from a single source.
- Discarded after use.

name: Dyson Sphere
effect:
This Dyson sphere surrounds the entire terrain.
- Triples the terrain point output.
- Terrain cannot be destroyed by any means until the dysin sphere is.
- All damage scored on this base is halved.

name: Early Shipment
effect:
- Played during the Allocation Phase.
- Four more supply points [Generated Points: ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Does not count as a card play.
- Discarded after use.

name: Entity Swap
effect:
- Once each complete turn, player may switch a crew card in the hand with a crew card in the fleet.
- Ability cards remain in play on the replacement crew card.
- Switch does not count as a card play.
- Return this card to your hand during the Discard Phase.
- Discarded when played in reaction mode or when a research point is applied to it in reaction mode.

name: Father of Time
effect: - The player with the most recently played father of time in play decides where every discard goes: To the discard pile or the bottom of the deck.

name: Flood
effect:
- Played on a terrain card.
- Affected terrain does not generate points until flood is negated.
- Negated by the application of points identical in type to the point output of the affected terrain card.

name: Frayed Time Spindle
effect:
Timelines are much like fiber optic cables with light (or time) traveling through them.
- May only be played on a stack totaling more than 20 strength points.
- Causes the stack of cards on which it is played to be discarded.
- Place at the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Future Ship
effect:
The ship on which this card is played is actually a technologically advanced ship from the future.
- Ship has twice as many phaser points [Modifier Points: 2x ✜].
- Ship can use foreign technology.

name: Future Transmission
effect:
A transmission from the future appears.
- On the turn played, all swaps to the reserve fleet do not count as card plays.
- Discarded after use.

name: Galacticnet
effect:
The galacticnet allows the electronic exchange of information.
- Each player takes one card from the hand of the opponent to the right and exposes it.
- Player of this card draws a number of cards from his deck equal to the lowest strength card exposed.
- Exposed cards are then returned to their owner's hands.
- Discarded after use.

name: Headquarters Overhaul
effect:
- When played to the owning player's Sector HQ, that Sector HQ's strength is raised to a strength of 10 points.
- Placed at the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Instant Reaction
effect:
- Played to a reaction card already in play in the fleet.
- Allows that card to react as if it were just played in reaction mode from the hand to any location.
- Immediately return this card to hand if the affected reaction card is of equal or lesser strength then this card. Immediately discard this card otherwise.

name: Intercept Action
effect:
Allows any ship in play in the fleet to intercept damage scored on another ship or base.
- Two points of damage are scored for every point intercepted.
- Discarded after use.

name: Invasion Force
effect:
- Requires a transporter or shuttle to do one of the following each turn:
- Cause one point of damage to a terrain card.
- Negate one point of opponent terrain output during opponent's next allocation phase (chosen by invasion force player).
- Disengage a base card of equal or lower strength.

name: Janitor
effect:
- All crew at a janitor's location are one strength point stronger.
- Each turn, may negate any 1 card played on or to an equipment card.
- When played in reaction, negates any toxic waste spill.

name: Lost In Space
effect:
- Played to any fighter or shuttlecraft.
- All crew on the fighter or shuttlecraft and the fighter or shuttlecraft are considered lost in space and cannot be used.
- Recovery of these cards occurs after 3 research and 3 economy points have been applied to this card.
- Discarded after use.

name: Mirror Skinned Phaser Eel
effect:
- Played to a phaser eel.
- Only the affected ship or base may fire on the phaser eel. Other units in the fleet or in other fleets may not.
- Lasts for 3 turns and is then discarded.

name: Monster Halt
effect:
A monster halt is played on a friendly monster already in play.
- One opponent monster cases to function until the friendly monster is discarded.
- A different opponent monster may be selected each turn.

name: Out of Phase World
effect:
Generated Points: ⚪⚪⚪

- If used for points it remains in phase and may be damaged normally. If not used for points it phases out and may not be damaged or repaired.
- Each turn out of phase, points accumulate (to a maximum of 9) until the world is brought into phase and used.
- Owning player chooses the phase turning the Allocation Phase.
- May not be combined or have ships, bases or dragons played on it.

  • Number: 147
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: T
  • Strength: 6
  • Artist: Michael Trapp

- If used for points it remains in phase and may be damaged normally. If not used for points it phases out and may not be damaged or repaired.
- Each turn out of phase, points accumulate (to a maximum of 9) until the world is brought into phase and used.
- Owning player chooses the phase turning the Allocation Phase.
- May not be combined or have ships, bases or dragons played on it.

name: Out of Season
effect:
Occasionally dragons mate or molt out of season.
- May do one of the following and is then discarded:
- Discard 1 dragon hatchling.
- Discard 1 molting card.
- Prevent dragon coupling, discarding that card before it is used.
- This card can be played to dragons.

name: Past Transmission
effect:
A transmission from the past appears.
- Opponent on which played cannot swap to the reserve fleet on the turn played.
- Cannot be played on turn 1 or 2.
- Discarded after use.

name: Phaser Distorter
effect:
Played on a ship.
- Requires energy equal to the strength of the ship to be activated.
- Activation uses a card play.
- A ship with an activated P.D. is immune to phaser fire.
- A ship cannot activate its P.D. if it fires phasers on the turn activation is to occur.
- Foreign technology to all empires.

name: Premonition
effect:
- Played to a crew card about to be discarded.
- The crew card on which premonition is played is placed back into hand and not discarded.
- Cards played to the crew are still discarded.
- Discarded after use.

name: Quantum Occurrence
effect:
- Played to the discard pile.
- All players restore their hands to 9 cards (no more or less) by drawing or discarding cards. Then each opponent (not the player of this card) discards 1 card from their hand.
- Discarded after use.

name: Repair Supply Base
effect:
S/N/AS: ✧✧✧✧✧✧

- When engaged, this base can hold unused repair points for use on the following turn.
- If repair points are not used on the following turn, they are lost.

✜✜✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 8
  • Rarity: R
  • Card Type: B
  • Strength: 8
  • Artist: Darryl Elliot

- When engaged, this base can hold unused repair points for use on the following turn.
- If repair points are not used on the following turn, they are lost.

✜✜✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 8
  • Rarity: R
  • Card Type: B
  • Strength: 8
  • Artist: Darryl Elliot
✜✜✜✜: Phasers

name: Repeat Fire
effect:
- Played to one ship or base in your fleet during Card Play Phase B.
- A second volley of damage (identical to that just scored by the ship in the Weapons Fire Phase) is scored on the same target(s) as the ship's first volley.
- Cannot be used if the Sector HQ is target by any of this fire.
- Discarded after use.

name: Research Mandator
effect:
A distant cousin of the research defiler, the research mandator affects the fleet on which it is played as follows:
- 1/2 of all economy points must be used as research points.
- Discarded when any monster-negating card is played to the fleet.
- No Ability cards may be played to this card.

name: Reserve Call Up
effect:
In times of crisis, the reserves may have to be called up.
- Up to 2 cards from the reserve fleet are moved into the hand or into the active fleet (not card plays).
- The cards removed from the reserve fleet are not replaced.
- Placed on bottom of discard pile after use.

name: Resource Theft
effect:
- Played to a ship in the fleet.
- A number of terrain points are taken from an opponent's terrain cards equal to the point requirements of the ship on which this card is played.
- Points are not available during affected opponent's Allocation Phase. Points are used to engage the ship.
- Discarded after use.

name: Sequential Continuum
effect:
- When the sequential continuum is played, the owning player may play any number of cards so-long-as the cards played are played consecutively and sequentially by strength (1, 2, 3,…).
- Swaps to the reserve fleet are allowed, but, count as regular card plays (3 maximum). They do not affect the sequence otherwise.
- Placed at the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Ship from the Future
effect:
S/N/AS: ✧x8

A ship appears through a time portal to render temporary assistance.
- Played in the engaged position.
- Discarded in the Engagement Phase after one complete turn unless destroyed earlier.

✜✜✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 136
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: R/S
  • Strength: 1
  • Artist: Bruce Jensen

A ship appears through a time portal to render temporary assistance.
- Played in the engaged position.
- Discarded in the Engagement Phase after one complete turn unless destroyed earlier.

✜✜✜✜: Phasers

  • Number: 136
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: R/S
  • Strength: 1
  • Artist: Bruce Jensen
✜✜✜✜: Phasers

name: Shipping Delays #1
effect:
- Played during an opponent's Allocation Phase.
- Four less supply points [Modifier Points: - ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Shipping Delays #10
effect:
- Played during an opponent's Allocation Phase.
- Four less supply points [Modifier Points: - ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Shipping Delays #2
effect:
- Played during an opponent's Allocation Phase.
- Four less supply points [Modifier Points: - ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Shipping Delays #3
effect:
- Played during an opponent's Allocation Phase.
- Four less supply points [Modifier Points: - ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Shipping Delays #4
effect:
- Played during an opponent's Allocation Phase.
- Four less supply points [Modifier Points: - ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Shipping Delays #5
effect:
- Played during an opponent's Allocation Phase.
- Four less supply points [Modifier Points: - ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Shipping Delays #6
effect:
- Played during an opponent's Allocation Phase.
- Four less supply points [Modifier Points: - ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Shipping Delays #7
effect:
- Played during an opponent's Allocation Phase.
- Four less supply points [Modifier Points: - ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Shipping Delays #8
effect:
- Played during an opponent's Allocation Phase.
- Four less supply points [Modifier Points: - ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Shipping Delays #9
effect:
- Played during an opponent's Allocation Phase.
- Four less supply points [Modifier Points: - ⚫⚫⚫⚫] are generated that turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Space-Time Diversion
effect:
- Draw one card from an opponent deck, expose it and place it in front of you.
- This card is not in play and is considered part of your hand. It may then be used normally.
- When discarded, card is returned to its owner's discard pile.
- Discarded after use.

name: Space-Time Portal
effect:
- Played on a terrain card.
- Terrain card (not those cards played to it) is returned to hand, not discarded, when terrain is destroyed.
- Discarded after use.

name: Star Well
effect:
- Played on a ship or base when the ship or base is played.
- Affected unit falls into the star well and cannot be engaged or protect its Sector HQ.
- Discarded after the allocation of energy points equal to twice the strength of the ship or base or the play of a tractor or repulsion beam to the affected unit.

name: Starburst Accelerator
effect:
- Played to any star, system or white dwarf terrain card.
- Each turn, causes damage equal to the terrain card's unmodified strength to any 1 ship, or base in play in an opponent fleet.
- This damage is treated as weapons fire.
- Consumes 1/2 the energy point output of the terrain.
- Discarded when the terrain card is.

name: Statis Canister - Stasis Canister
effect:
- Played on a ship, base or terrain card.
- One crew card at location is saved from any health affecting card by being placed in stasis (crew does not function).
- 1/2 the research is required to negate the health affecting card.

name: Stellar Gas Cloud
effect:
A cloud of matter which engulfs terrain.
- Played on a terrain card.
- No weapons fire may affect the terrain or cards stacked with it.
- Monsters may not affect the terrain.
- Terrain card and cards played on the terrain may not fire weapons.
- All other functions are not affected.
- Discarded after research points equal to twice its strength have been applied.

name: Suark Beast
effect:
- Each turn, may discard any one Suark Breed card in play in any opponent fleet.
- Discarded when no Suark Breed cards are in play.

name: Suark Breed [C1]
effect:
- This card gains two strength points for every other Suark Breed card in play in any fleet.
- When any crew card in any fleet is discarded, discard the lowest strength Suark Breed instead.
- The one player with the strongest Suark Breed card in play (no ties) may play a card on every opponent Card Play Phase A. This card takes no action until the owner's turn.

name: Suark Breed [C2]
effect:
- This card gains one strength point for every other Suark Breed card in play in any fleet.
- When any crew card in any fleet is discarded, discard the lowest strength Suark Breed instead.
- The one player with the strongest Suark Breed card in play (no ties) may play a card on every opponent Card Play Phase A. This card takes no action until the owner's turn.

name: Suark Breed [C3]
effect:
- This card gains one strength point for every other Suark Breed card in play in any fleet.
- When any crew card in any fleet is discarded, discard the lowest strength Suark Breed instead.
- The one player with the strongest Suark Breed card in play (no ties) may play a card on every opponent Card Play Phase A. This card takes no action until the owner's next turn.

name: Suark Breed [C4]
effect:
- This card gains one strength point for every other Suark Breed card in play in any fleet.
- When any crew card in any fleet is discarded, discard the lowest strength Suark Breed instead.
- The one player with the strongest Suark Breed card in play (no ties) may play a card on every opponent Card Play Phase A. This card takes no action until the owner's next turn.

name: Suark Breed [C5]
effect:
- This card gains one strength point for every other Suark Breed card in play in any fleet.
- When any crew card in any fleet is discarded, discard the lowest strength Suark Breed instead.
- The one player with the strongest Suark Breed card in play (no ties) may play a card on every opponent Card Play Phase A. This card takes no action until the owner's next turn.

name: Suark Breed [C6]
effect:
- This card loses one strength point for every other Suark Breed card in play in any fleet.
- When any crew card in any fleet is discarded, discard the lowest strength Suark Breed instead.
- The one player with the strongest Suark Breed card in play (no ties) may play a card on every opponent Card Play Phase A. This card takes no action until the owner's next turn.

name: Suspended Animation
effect:
Actually a timeline which is occurring much slower then this one.
- The opponent on which played immediately stops playing cards.
- May not be played until opponent has played at least 1 card.
- May not be played on turn 1 or 2.
- Placed on the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Temporal Comprehension
effect:
On rare occasion a being becomes capable of understanding and altering time.
- The crew, dragon, monster or psy card on which this card is played may perform its card actions twice each turn, once during each Card Play Phase.

name: Temporal Correction
effect:
- When played, this card allows the owning player to discard any one card played or in play against the fleet.
- Does not block card actions.
- Discarded after use.

name: Temporal Engineer
effect:
- Played on ships or bases.
- Immediately draw 2 cards when this card is played.
- As a card play may be paced at the bottom of the discard pile moving the card there to the hand.
- As a reaction, the ship or base may ignore 1 opponent volley. Temporal engineer is discarded to do this.

name: Temporal Fighter
effect:
- A temporal fighter may make one there-and-back to the time origin each turn:
- It may transport one crew card there-and-back.
- or -
- It may move one time knight from the time origin to the fleet.

✜✜: Phasers (one shot only)

  • Number: 56
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: E
  • Strength: 9
  • Artist: Darryl Elliot
✜✜: Phasers (one shot only)

name: Temporal Ion Storm
effect:
Generated Points: ☓☓☓

This ion storm exists in multiple timelines.
- Causes damage indicated above to one ship or base in each opponent fleet.
- Discarded after use.

  • Number: 61
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: H
  • Strength: 6
  • Artist: Randy Asplund-Faith

This ion storm exists in multiple timelines.
- Causes damage indicated above to one ship or base in each opponent fleet.
- Discarded after use.

name: Temporal Loophole
effect:
- Played during the Allocation Phase.
A temporal loophole allows any one other card to be played during the Allocation Phase.
- Both of these cards count as card plays.
- Discarded after use.

name: Temporal Mechanic
effect:
Specializing in time mechanics, a temporal mechanic allows the following each turn:
- Allows 1 extra card to be drawn during each Draw Card Phase.
- One card (from those drawn) is placed on the bottom of the deck.

name: Temporal Shifter
effect:
Allows the crew card on which it is played to phase sideways through time.
- Whenever location is destroyed move (shift) crew card to another location of choice.
- Discard this card after 2 shifts.

name: Temporal Shuttle
effect:
- A temporal shuttle may make one there-and-back to the time origin each turn:
- It may transport up to three crew cards there-and-back.
- or -
- It may move one time knight from the time origin to the fleet.

✜: Phaser (one shot only)

  • Number: 46
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: E
  • Strength: 7
  • Artist: Christina Wald
✜: Phaser (one shot only)

name: Temporal Snake [M2/8]
effect:
- Played to the time origin.
- When a time card is played by an opponent, it moves to that fleet.
- Causes damage [Generated Points: ☓☓] to one target each turn.
- When destroyed in the fleet is moved to the time origin. When destroyed in the time origin is discarded.
- Destroyed by a monster negating crew card or research points in the fleet. Destroyed by time damage in the time origin.

name: Temporal Snake [M4/6]
effect:
- Played to the time origin.
- When a time card is played by an opponent, it moves to that fleet.
- Causes damage [Generated Points: ☓☓☓☓] to one target each turn.
- When destroyed in the fleet is moved to the time origin. When destroyed in the time origin is discarded.
- Destroyed by a monster negating crew card or research points in the fleet. Destroyed by time damage in the time origin.

name: Temporal Snake [M6/4]
effect:
- Played to the time origin.
- When a time card is played by an opponent, it moves to that fleet.
- Causes damage [Generated Points: ☓☓☓☓☓☓] to one target each turn.
- When destroyed in the fleet is moved to the time origin. When destroyed in the time origin is discarded.
- Destroyed by a monster negating crew card or research points in the fleet. Destroyed by time damage in the time origin.

name: Temporal Transporter [R/E3]
effect:
- Played to a ship, base or terrain card.
- Allows any number of crew cards at the transporter's location to each make 1 there-and-back mission to the time origin.

name: Temporal Transporter [R/E7]
effect:
- Played to a ship, base or terrain card.
- Allows any number of crew cards at a location to each make 1 there-and-back mission to the time origin.
- Allows a crew card at the time origin to be moved into the fleet.

name: Time Assault Team
effect:
A time assault team goes back in time to assault an enemy hoping to alter its future potential.
- When played in reaction mode, causes damage equal to its strength to any ship or base just played returning to a location in the active fleet (no transportation needed).
- May cause one damage point each turn via there-and-back missions.

name: Time Capsule [E2]
effect:
An ancient time capsule is activated.
- Played to a location.
- Move a number of unexposed cards equal to the time capsule's strength, from the deck to the time capsule card.
- Place cards into hand during the Engagement Phase 2 turns later.
- Destroyed (along with unexposed cards) by destruction of location.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Capsule [E4]
effect:
An ancient time capsule is activated.
- Played to a location.
- Move a number of unexposed cards equal to the time capsule's strength, from the deck to the time capsule card.
- Place cards into hand during the Engagement Phase 3 turns later.
- Destroyed (along with unexposed cards) by destruction of the location.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Capsule [E6]
effect:
An ancient time capsule is activated.
- Played to a location.
- Move a number of unexposed cards equal to the time capsule's strength, from the deck to the time capsule card.
- Place cards into hand during the Engagement Phase 4 turns later.
- Destroyed (along with unexposed cards) by destruction of the location.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Compression
effect:
Played on one opponent.
- Opponent may play a maximum of 2 cards on his next or current turn.
- These cards must be played in only on card play phase.
- May be played in reaction to stop the third and subsequent card plays.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Discrepancy
effect:
The further back in time a being travels the greater the chances of the current timeline being altered.
- Played to any opponent time card just played.
- The affected card is either discarded, or it functions twice against its intended target at discrepancy player's option.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Dragoness [D6]
effect:
Time dragons exist in all times.

{W}: Time Breath (may be fired once each turn at any available targets at a cost of one ammunition point per target) No modification is allowed.
- Time breath occurs before all other weapons fire and does not count as a weapons volley.

  • Number: 38
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: D
  • Strength: 6
  • Point Requirements: ■■■■
  • Artist: jael

{W}: Time Breath (may be fired once each turn at any available targets at a cost of one ammunition point per target) No modification is allowed.
- Time breath occurs before all other weapons fire and does not count as a weapons volley.

name: Time Enclave [T2]
effect:
- All time knights of strength 5 or less in play in the fleets who are destroyed are moved to this card, not to the time origin.
- May not be removed by any means.
- Time knight can be returned to the time origin after the allocation of research points equal to its origin strength.
- When this card is discarded, all time knights on the enclave are discarded, not moved to the time origin.

name: Time Enclave [T6]
effect:
- All time knights in play in fleets who are destroyed are moved to this card, not to the time origin.
- May not be removed by any means.
- Time knight can be returned to the time origin after the allocation of research points equal to its origin strength.
- When this card is discarded, all time knights on the enclave are discarded, not moved to the time origin.

name: Time Evacuation
effect:
- Played on a card or stack of cards just discarded.
- Card or stack of cards is set aside out of play (cannot be affected).
- Card or stack of cards is immediately brought back into play undamaged when a strength 1 card is drawn from the deck and exposed in the Draw Cards Phase.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Exchange
effect:
- When played to the discard pile (card play) allows the owning player to discard 1 card from his hand replacing it with a newly drawn card (not a card play).
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Expansion
effect:
- Up to 4 cards of equal or lesser strength than this card do not count as card plays on the turn this card is played.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Fiend
effect:
- Played to an opponent fleet.
- During his Card Play Phases opponent may not play cards of higher strength than the time fiend.
- Each turn the time find gets 1 point stronger.
- Discarded when reaching strength 10.
- Discarded by application of research points equaling the fiend's current strength applied in one turn.

name: Time Gap Generator
effect:
A time gap generator allows a ship or base to create an escape portal into the near future.
- Played on a unit which is just about to be destroyed.
- Unit and all accompanying cards are taken out of play for the current opponent turn. Unit is returned to the fleet (undamaged by the last volley) at the end of the opponent's turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Gate
effect:
- Played to any ship or base which is about to be discarded.
- Ship or base and all accompanying cards are set aside out of play instead.
- The stack is returned to play fully repaired 2 turns later during the Allocation Phase (regardless of command limits).

name: Time Guardian
effect:
This friendly monster protects crew or psy beings.
- Played on a crew or psy card.
- Affected crew or psy cannot be attacked by a card play or action until the time guardian is destroyed.
- Destroyed by crew card damage equal to its strength.

name: Time Intrusion
effect:
A time intrusion occurs when 2 timelines temporarily share the same time.
- Played on two terrain, ship, base, psy, dragon or monster cards. One belonging to each of two opponents.
- Damage is caused to each card equal to the strength of the other card.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Jump
effect:
Often a ship, crewman, etc, can jump back slightly in time allowing an action or event to be altered.
- The (engaged) card or stack of cards on which this card is played may perform all it's functions and attacks during an opponent's turn (Card Play or Weapons Fire Phase as appropriate).
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Keeper
effect:
Appears when the timeline has gotten out of whack. The time keeper has come to correct it.
- Negates any one time card, discarding it.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Knight [C1/9]
effect:
- When destroyed in the fleet is moved to the time origin. When destroyed in the time origin is discarded.
- Is only destroyed by time damage when in the time origin.
- At owner's choice, any reaction card played to location is treated as if two such cards were played there.

name: Time Lore
effect:
Give a crew or dragon the knowledge of time lore. As that crew's only action or function, allows the following each turn:
- View the top card on each opponent deck (replace unexposed).
- Place one of these cards at the bottom of the owner's deck (exposing it first).

name: Time Merchant
effect:
- Each turn that less than the maximum number of card plays are used, the time merchant allows one unused card play to be used on the following turn in addition to the card plays for that turn.
- May sell this one card play to another player (highest bid in economy points paid on next Allocation Phase).

name: Time Screen
effect:
- Played on a terrain or base card.
- Allows the base or terrain card to ignore damage points from any one type of source (either a weapons volley or a card play) when played.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Shield
effect:
- Played with and on top of one unexposed ship stack (any type & number of cards from the hand).
- Time shield card is discarded during the Allocation Phase of the next turn, exposing the stack.
- Stack can be fired upon and sustain damage (as appropriate).
- Expose and discard stack if damage sufficient to destroy it is sustained.

name: Time Ship [S1]
effect:
- Played in the engaged position.
- Allows one time knight with a fleet strength of 3 or less to shift from the time origin to the active fleet.
- Discarded after use during the Discard Phase.

✜: Time Phaser (may be fired once at all available targets in one fleet)

  • Number: 137
  • Rarity: C
  • Card Type: S
  • Strength: 1
  • Artist: Douglas Chaffee
✜: Time Phaser (may be fired once at all available targets in one fleet)

name: Time Ship [S3]
effect:
- Played in the engaged position.
- Allows one time knight with a fleet strength of 6 or less to shift from the time origin to the active fleet.
- Discarded after use during the Discard Phase.

✜: Time Phaser (may be fired once at all available targets in one fleet)

  • Number: 139
  • Rarity: U
  • Card Type: S
  • Strength: 3
  • Artist: Douglas Chaffee
✜: Time Phaser (may be fired once at all available targets in one fleet)

name: Time Skip
effect:
A time skip is played on an opponent card or stack of cards.
- Card or stack of cards is treated as if it were not there.
- Lasts for one player turn.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Switch
effect:
- Played to a card or stack of cards which has just been discarded.
- Discarded stack is placed on the bottom of the deck instead of being discarded.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Thief
effect:
- Played on a stack of cards.
- Each turn, owner of the affected stack must use a card play to move the time thief to a stack in another fleet (except the time thief player's fleet) or discard one card (not a card in play) played to or against any part of that stack.
- Discarded when a card of greater strength is discarded from the affected stack in response to this card.

name: Time Tornado
effect:
Time tornadoes appear out of time distorting the surrounding area.
- The stack on which this card is played is shuffled into a mini deck and placed next to the owner's main deck. One card is drawn from this mini deck each Draw Cards Phase in addition to those drawn from the main deck.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Trap
effect:
- Played on any card or stack of cards.
- The card or stack of cards is treated as if it were not there until research points equal to the strength of the time trap have been applied.
- May only be played in reaction mode when played to the owning player's fleet.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Typhoon
effect:
A time typhoon is a temporal storm which distorts recent history.
- Played on a discard pile.
- Owner of the discard piles shuffles the discard pile.
- Player of this card shuffles it.
- Owner cuts it.
- Discarded after use.

name: Time Wave [H5]
effect:
Each opponent must discard a card of 3 or higher strength from their active fleets if one or more is in play when this card is played.
- Placed at the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Time Wave [H7]
effect:
Each opponent must discard a card of 5 or higher strength from their active fleets if one or more is in play when this card is played.
- Placed at the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Time Wave [H9]
effect:
Each opponent must discard a card of 7 or higher strength from their active fleets if one or more is in play when this card is played.
- Placed at the bottom of the discard pile after use.

name: Timeline Alteration
effect:
Go back in time and alter events.
- 1 to 3 of the top three cards on your discard pile may be exchanged with cards of the same card type currently in play in the fleet.
- These do not count as card plays.
- Condition of card(s) currently in play is transferred to the replacement card(s).
- Discarded after use.

name: Tranoan Battlecruiser
effect:
S/N/AS: ✧✧✧✧

- When destroyed in the fleet is moved to the time origin. When destroyed in the time origin is discarded.
- Must destroy locations with opponent time knights before targeting other locations.

name: Trophy Hunter
effect:
A trophy hunter hunts space monsters seeking to make trophys out of them.
- Requires a shuttle or transporter to perform a there-and-back mission against one monster once each turn.
- A monster of equal or lesser strength is discarded each turn.
- If the monster card is stronger than the trophy hunter, the trophy hunter is also discarded.

name: Twist of Fate
effect:
- Played on any stack except the basis of a stack.
- At defender's option, affected card is either placed at the bottom of the discard pile, placed back into the hand or placed into the reserve fleet, discarding one card there.
- The same thing happens to this card, as happened to the defender's card.

name: Unlucky Crew Action
effect:
- The crew card on which it is played is affected twice by the first negative luck or occurrence card played to that crew card.
- Discarded after use.

name: Vacuum Effect
effect:
The vacuum effect removes things from this timeline sending them elsewhen.
- May be played on any card except the basis of a stack.
- Affected card is placed at the bottom of the discard pile.
- Discarded after use.

name: Veterinarian
effect: - When in play, heals 3 points [Generated Points: ♦♦♦] of damage to any monster or dragon in play in the fleet each turn.

name: Well of Time
effect:
- Played to the fleet.
- During the Draw Cards Phase a card is drawn, exposed and placed on the well, then more cards are drawn and placed on the well until a card of greater strength than the first is drawn (to a maximum of 8 cards).
- Cards are out of play and cannot be attacked.
- When research points equal to the strength of the well are applied, cards played on the well are moved into the hand.
- Discarded after use.

name: Wreckage Survivors
effect:
- When played, the first three crew in the discard pile of equal or lesser strength than this card are returned to the hand.
- Discarded after use.
